Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Nail (?)
Description: This copper bolt, barely oxidised, has a square cross section. The point is very sharp and measures 3,6 cm in length. The upper extremity is 0,4 cm wide. The shaft of the bolt tapers and its cross section becomes circular (diametre: 0,2cm). The bolt ends with a flat hook that is extremely curved (0,2 cm wide and 0,5 cm thick), as if it had been hammered.
